title: Looking for a font similar to Bello
content: I am looking for a font similar to Bello SC (specifically SC) that is free or cheap, like $10-$20. I am writing a tutorial that utilizes Bello and I want my readers to be able to replicate the effect without shelling out $55
author: Tristis

comments.content: Is there really that big of a difference between $20 and $55? Are you writing for low-income designers?

I'm writing for beginners with little to no Photoshop experience, who do this as a hobby. Not everybody has $50 to spare on some tutorial they see (including me). I want it to be more accessible to people, so a freeware font would be nice.

The effect? Not really understanding what you want in regards to Bello. I suppose Arial is to Helvetica in what i understand you're sort of wanting, but Bello is pretty unique and finding some random typeface online is unlikely.

**Edited**

Are you creating a illustration comp using Photoshop? Feel is one thing, but the user could use any typeface to at least try the techniques out.

They can try effect out, I guess. Heh. I just decided to go ahead with the font.  
You can check out the rather simple tutorial at [http://magnusfx.com/graphics/text-quickie-bello](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419013312/http:/magnusfx.com/graphics/text-quickie-bello "http://magnusfx.com/graphics/text-quickie-bello")

Too late now, I guess, but check out [Talking Five Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419013312/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/talking-five/). A very nice font for $12.

Also, while it's a bit lighter, lots of Windows users have Maiandra Demi Bold because it is bundled with [various MS products](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419013312/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/fonts/font.aspx?FMID=1004).
